meanings.definition: Covered with small bristles or setae.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had a setulose body, making it look prickly.
meanings.sent2: The cactus had setulose thorns for protection.
meanings.sent3: The setulose surface of the kiwi fruit made it difficult to peel.
meanings.sent4: Her setulose hair stood on end when she heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent5: The setulose texture of the fabric felt rough against her skin.

meanings.definition: Having or resembling small bristles or setae.
meanings.sent1: The tiny insect had setulose legs that helped it climb walls.
meanings.sent2: The plant had setulose leaves that felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The setulose brush made painting a fun and textured experience.
meanings.sent4: His setulose beard gave him a rugged and outdoorsy look.
meanings.sent5: The setulose surface of the rock provided a good grip for climbing.
